tagline: Where the Queen of Pain invites you to suffer beautifully.

course.terrain_type: High desert gravel with sustained climbs
course.terrain_surface: Well-maintained gravel roads, some chunky sections, forest service roads
course.signature_challenge: The combination of distance, altitude, and relentless terrain. Nothing is crazy steep—but nothing is flat either.
course.character: Big mountain beauty with sustained but manageable climbing. Not the steepest grades, but relentless.

suffering_zones.label: Trail Creek Climb
suffering_zones.desc: The signature climb. Long and steady. Pace yourself.

suffering_zones.label: Afternoon Exposure
suffering_zones.desc: Open terrain, sun beating down, halfway fatigue settling in.

suffering_zones.label: Final Push
suffering_zones.desc: You can see Ketchum. But there's still climbing between you and the finish.

course.climate_description: September in Idaho brings crisp mornings, warm afternoons, and possibility of early fall weather

biased_opinion.summary: RPI is what happens when a legendary athlete shares her passion with the community. It's not the hardest race, not the longest, not the most technical—but it might be the most soulful. The combination of world-class scenery, genuine community, and Rebecca's personal involvement makes this special.

logistics.parking: Start area parking requires early arrival. Shuttles may be available.

searchable_text: Rebecca's Private Idaho Where the Queen of Pain invites you to suffer beautifully. Big mountain beauty with sustained but manageable climbing. Not the steepest grades, but relentless. The combination of distance, altitude, and relentless terrain. Nothing is crazy steep—but nothing is flat either.
